Pennsylvania is the only major gas: producing state in the US that does not have a severance tax on natural gas drilling.
Instead of a severance tax: Pennsylvania charges an annual impact fee for every gas well that is drilled.
The left: leaning Pennsylvania Budget and Policy Center estimates that implementing a severance tax could generate an additional $1.7 billion over five years.
Other major gas: producing states like Texas, Oklahoma, and Louisiana have severance taxes that vary in rates and structures. For example, Texas charges a 7.5% tax on the market value of oil and natural gas extracted within its borders.
